Articles.Content:
Yo everyone! I'm DaHappyNoobie, french Kerbonaut, and ready to blow up things/do science!!

Even after hours and hours on stock KSP I never really managed to go interplanetary, I hope I will find some good tips in here :3

I also enjoy playing with mods, and there is an awful lot of quality content referenced here, it's amazing!

See you guys on the forum o/

See you guys on the forum?

You already have! Welcome!
Welcome aboard! There's always plenty to do and see here!

Did someone call for an evil genius?

*holds up a flask of bubbling liquid and a bag full of sepratrons*

Anyone?

Did someone call for an evil genius?

*holds up a flask of bubbling liquid and a bag full of sepratrons*

Anyone?

You. I like you.

We suffer from the same problems. I am also too used to the snuggling embrace of the Mun and Minmus! But together we can break free, brother.

ONWARDS! and welcome to the forums, by the way.

Best way to do an interplanetary mission is just to send a cheap, small probe out there, the delta-v costs aren't that much higher in the cases of Duna and Eve, just more complicated maneuvers.

That way, you're not risking any crew, and it can just feel like a quick mission.
I'll try sending a probe, figuring out the manoeuvers will be the hardest part ^^

Evil genius, you say? *Laughs maniacally with lightning and thunder in the background*

Muahahahaha, MUAAHHAHAHAhack-cough-cough wheeze

Welcome to the club...

Edited January 25, 2015 by NeatCrown

Evil genius, you say? *Laughs maniacally with lightning and thunder in the background*

Muahahahaha, MUAAHHAHAHAhack-cough-cough wheeze

Welcome to the club...

I love how much formatting went into that evil laugh.
